intro: Sebastiania hispida var. oligophylla, commonly known as the velvetleaf sebastiania, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is characterized by its dark green, leathery leaves that are covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a velvety appearance. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are clustered in cup-like structures called cyathia, typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant is often grown as an ornamental due to its attractive foliage and adaptability to various soil types.
